p: Next, we tested the effect of regorafenib and sorafenib on susceptibility of primary human airway epithelial cells from bronchi (hAECB). We used the same dose as with A549 cells, 3 μM, a dose not cytotoxic for hAECB cells ( S9B Fig). Also in primary cells, UBKIs efficiently blocked viral protein expression ( Fig 6C). Then, we assessed both UBKIs effects on viral replication in hAECB cells. To this end, we employed the highest dose without detectable cytotoxicity to hAECB cells, 5 μM ( S9B and S9D Fig). Again, both inhibitors revealed a significant reduction of virus replication, although the effect induced by regorafenib was found to be more pronounced, especially at later time points ( Fig 6D).
